intro: Barleria napalensis var. microphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable ornamental plant in arid and semi-arid regions.
